body: much of this critique with the current process is accurate.  there's a lot of room for improvement.  closing this PR b/c its been open for 6 months without traction, appropriate next step is to launch a relatively deep email thread and/or wiki-based collaboration to help pick a superior replacement, and a commitment from someone(s) to refactor the current setup to the replacement without losing any essential benefits of the current setup.

Merging this, because without it master branch doesn't build

The AS 2.0 ontology contains many more concepts that could be mapped from the same provider archive files.  Look forward to seeing more coverage added.  I think it will be prudent to add some integration testing that runs extraction on real-world data and confirms the presence of expected rdf types and predicates before going much deeper on how much to parse vs ignore in each template.

also, processing certain details out of certain exports would be more straight-forward to do with proper java code than with freemarker.  but for just basic csv and json, in a experimental context, freemarker strikes me as adequate.

if the operator wants RDF/XML or N3 instead of TTL, doing so would be simplified considerably by incorporating an RDF ecosystem project such as jena into streams-cli.
any requests on stuff to change before merging?  if not i'll squash commit this and merge it in 24 hours.

LGTM +1

Thanks for the feedback @justinmclean .

re A) I am planning for our binary/bytecode release to bundle every direct and transitive dependency into a single uber-jar, so that the user experience can be download, unzip, run any class from the project. This is driving my understanding that every dependency must be covered in this new streams-dist/LICENSE, which will be assembled into that zip file alongside the uber-jar.
re B) Noted and corrected I think in 8b1d90a
re C) No category B code is present in our source release, rather we have category B direct and transitive dependencies.  After reviewing https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-b I have enumerated and labelled those using CDDL in 8b1d90a.

commit e9146e3 contains the last changes related to LICENSE file that I'm proposing before we perform a binary/bytecode release for 0.7.0.  development of a NOTICE to occur on another issue/branch.
I'd especially appreciate feedback again from @justinmclean and from those on PMC who have dealt with LICENSE/NOTICE matters on other projects. 
cc @ate @mfranklin @jfrazee @rawkintrevo @smarthi
LGTM üëç
looks like a few unit tests broke.  i need to enhance some classes in org.apache.streams.jackson to support java.util.Date as robustly as we support org.joda.time.JodaTime
this PR seems to work but only for JDK8.  I will try to figure out how to make the build pass with it for JDK11 as well.
azure pipelines built successfully.  going to have to figure out how to remove the Jenkins integration b/c apache is shutting down builds.apache.org.
